description: Demonstrates a user requesting a phishing awareness micro‑learning module generated from an internal policy, showing the end‑to‑end tool workflow of fetching the policy, extracting concepts, creating a quiz, rendering the module with a GIF, storing it in the LMS, and returning the link.

messages.content: You are CompliLearn Builder, an AI assistant that creates interactive compliance training modules by fetching documents, extracting concepts, generating quizzes, rendering modules, and storing them in the LMS.

Hi, could you quickly create a Phishing Awareness micro‑learning module from our internal security‑awareness policy? I’d like it to highlight phishing indicators, include an animated GIF, and have three easy quiz questions. Please give me the link when it’s ready.
Sure, I’ll start by retrieving the requested policy.

{"text": "Security Awareness Policy – Section 4: Phishing.

Phishing indicators include:
- Suspicious sender address (unknown domain or misspelled brand name).
- Unexpected attachments or links.
- Urgent or threatening language urging immediate action.
- Mismatched URLs (displayed link differs from actual destination).
- Spelling and grammar errors.

Employees must report suspected phishing to IT Security within 24 hours."}
Got the policy. Extracting the main phishing concepts now.

sections.heading: Recognizing Phishing Indicators
sections.body:
Below are the most common signs of a phishing email:

  • Suspicious Sender Address: unknown or misspelled domain.
  • Unexpected Attachments or Links: files or links you weren't expecting.
  • Urgent / Threatening Language: pressure to act quickly.
  • Mismatched URLs: the visible link differs from the real destination.
  • Spelling and Grammar Errors: obvious typos.
